page.title: 07FARMING IN PAXFORD AREA (1)
page.content: There are 7 farms of 50 hectares and over.The remainder are smaller holdings.4 farms are tenanted,the rest are freehold with 6 of these in 2nd or 3rd generation occupation.Crops are equally divided between cereals grass- land and vegetables.Cereals are mainly winter planted wheat and barley,grown with artificial fertiliser.Weeds and diseases are controlled by chemical spraying.Grain is cut with combine harvester and stored on the farm for later sale.Straw is removed in bales or burnt.Vegetables include potatoes, sprouts,peas,cabbage,soft fruit, tomatoes under glass.Only 15 hectares of orchards of apples pears and plums remain in former fruit growing area. Some produce is on a 'Pick your own' basis,much is picked by casual labour and sold to local retail outlets,at auction or to growers co-operatives.
